headline.main: THE AGED AND MEDICINE ARE FORMING AN ALLIANCE

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE medical procedures that Ronald Reagan went through earlier this month graphically illustrate a quiet revolution in medical care that has become part of growing old. It is a revolution people often forget until a prominent older individual's ailment makes the news or they face such procedures themselves.

byline.original: By THOMAS W. NETTER, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The World Health Organization, citing a sharp increase in smoking in the third world, has increased its budget for anti-smoking activities for the first time, an agency official said today.
